Uses of Class
tools.logger.syslog.SyslogException

Packages that use SyslogException
tools.logger.syslog Syslog facilities - allows to send message to local/distant syslog server. 
 

Uses of SyslogException in tools.logger.syslog
 

Methods in tools.logger.syslog that throw SyslogException
 void SyslogConnection.bind(java.lang.String hostname)
          Binds the Syslog class to a specified host for further logging.
 void SyslogConnection.send(java.net.InetAddress addr, int port, int fac, int pri, java.lang.String msg)
          Use this method to log your syslog messages.
 

Constructors in tools.logger.syslog that throw SyslogException
SyslogConnection(java.lang.String processName, int flags)
          Creates a Syslog connection instance, targeted by default on LOCALHOST (127.0.0.1) The only flag locally used is 'LOG_PERROR', which will log the message to Java's 'System.err'.
SyslogConnection(java.lang.String hostname, int port, java.lang.String processName, int flags)
          Creates a Syslog object instance, targeted for the UNIX host with the hostname 'hostname' on the syslog port 'port'.
